value:
To think I was brought here by a
plebeian masquerading as a
summoner. A cruel joke indeed.

I once belonged to the Deliverance...
but I eventually had to take my leave.
I serve Lord Berkut of Rigel now.

If you insist on ordering me around,
you should at least look the part.
I'd start with a change of clothes.

Take care not to send me into battle
with any rabble from the Deliverance.
It would not end well, I assure you.

Can't you see that I'm busy? There's
too much to learn about this world to
spend my time entertaining you.

It's rude to keep a noble waiting, you
know. Allow me to deliver this from
$Nf and be done.

Proper form, perfect precision...
Though who would expect anything
less from true nobility?
This will have to do.
Damn it all...
A wise choice. You will not regret it.

I am Fernand, and my fealty is
earned, not given. You have a lot of
work ahead of you, "Summoner."

Long ago, I formed the Deliverance
with two like-minded souls, Clive
and Mathilda, to save our homeland.$k$pThose were the days. We fought as
one heart and mind for Zofia, inching
ever closer to our shared goal.$k$pBut along the way, something
changed. I blamed Clive at first, but
perhaps the fault is my own.$k$pI can't say I enjoy being under your
command, but it is a distraction, and
for that I am grateful.$k$pSomeday I shall quell the doubts in
my mind... For now, however, you
have my lance.
たあっ
雑魚が！
ぐっ…
生意気な…
Know your place.
Submit!
Foolish rabble!
Don't get in my way.
Finally...together...
フン…
I am Fernand, a son of Zofia—but my ties there are in the past.
Mind yourself, plebian. This is no time for levity.
Imagine me taking orders from some wretched farmchild... Hah! Not likely.
Lord Berkut shares my perspective. That alone earns him my trust.
Seeing children about the castle grounds, I'm reminded of my— Ah, it is better to forget.
Why, Clive... Why wouldn't you listen?
You may be a complete stranger, but...you have my trust. For now.
Sufficient.
Hasty, are we?
Give no quarter.
